page.title: 13FARMING in RHAYADER
page.content: The area is made up of small farms rearing sheep and some cattle.Most crops are grown for fodder.Markets are held in the town,cattle being sold monthly on Wednesdays and sheep(fat lambs) weekly on Fridays from July to February.Old 'hiring' fairs still surviving as auctions are Dom Fair in December,Cwmdeuddwr Feast in February, May Fair on 12th May and Sheep Fairs in September and October.Land prices in 1985 were Â£1500/acre with hill farm subsidies of Â£54.50 for cattle and Â£6.50 for ewes.Cattle breeds kept in the area include Charolais,Welsh Black and Freesians which sell at auction for Â£225-Â£350.Sheep breeds include Speckled Face/South Down and White Face Welsh/Border Leicester,selling for Â£58-Â£78.Shearing takes place from May-July,average prices being Â£1/kg.
